alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Rice (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 8:29PM CDT until April 07 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Minnesota... Cannon River at Northfield affecting Rice and Dakota Counties. .Melting snow combined with precipitation that fell a few days ago has led to an increase in river levels. With another system arriving tomorrow and Wednesday, further rises to the levels are expected, with flood stage being exceeded Tuesday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cannon River at Northfield. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 897.5 feet, Flood waters reach Carleton College soccer fields. Babcock Park north of downtown begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM CDT Monday, the stage was 896.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 897.7 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 897.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 898.1 feet on 10/06/2019. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
